edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.platform.action

Class RuntimeMessageAction<T extends RuntimePlatform>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.platform.action.RuntimeAction<T>
      • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.platform.action.RuntimeMessageAction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the concrete RuntimePlatform subclass type containing the action
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callable<RuntimeActionResult>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PostMessage, PostMessage, PostMessage

    public abstract class RuntimeMessageAction<T extends RuntimePlatform>
extends RuntimeAction<T>
    An abstract RuntimeAction processing a message.

    This class takes a String message as its constructor parameter, and relies on RuntimeContexts.fillContextValues(String) to pre-process it and replace context variable accesses by their concrete value.

    This class is only responsible of the pre-processing of the provided message, and does not provide any method to print it to the end user.

    See Also:
    RuntimePlatform, RuntimeContexts

    • Field Detail

      • message

        protected String message
        The processed message.

        This attribute is the result of calling RuntimeContexts.fillContextValues(String) on the rawMessage constructor parameter. Concrete subclasses can use this attribute to print the processed message to the end user.

        See Also:
        RuntimeContexts.fillContextValues(String), getMessage()

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuntimeMessageAction

        public RuntimeMessageAction(T runtimePlatform,
                            JarvisSession session,
                            String rawMessage)
        Constructs a new RuntimeMessageAction with the provided runtimePlatform, session, and rawMessage.

        This constructor stores the result of calling RuntimeContexts.fillContextValues(String) on the rawMessage parameter. Concreted subclasses can use this attribute to print the processed message to the end user.

        Parameters:
        runtimePlatform - the RuntimePlatform containing this action
        session - the JarvisSession associated to this action
        rawMessage - the message to process
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided runtimePlatform or session is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided rawMessage is null or empty
        See Also:
        JarvisSession, RuntimeContexts

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Retrieve the JarvisSession associated to the client of the message and merges it with the current one.

        This method relies on getClientSession() to retrieve the JarvisSession associated to the client of the message, and merges the current session with the client one if they are different. This allows to pass client-independent context variables (e.g. from RuntimeEventProviders) to new client sessions.

        Overrides:
        init in class RuntimeAction<T extends RuntimePlatform>
        Throws:
        JarvisException - if the provided session is different from the getClientSession() and the merge operation between the contexts failed

      • call

        public RuntimeActionResult call()
        Runs the RuntimeMessageAction and returns its result wrapped in a RuntimeActionResult.

        This method handles IOExceptions by trying to send again the message after waiting <number_of_retries>*500 ms, in case the issue is related to network stability. The default number of retries is 3. If the message cannot be sent after 3 retries the thrown IOException is wrapped in the returned RuntimeActionResult and handled as a regular exception.

        The returned RuntimeActionResult.getExecutionTime() value includes all the attempts to send the message.

        This method should not be called manually, and is handled by the ExecutionService component that manages and executes RuntimeActions.

        This method does not throw any Exception if the underlying RuntimeAction's computation does not complete. Exceptions thrown during the RuntimeMessageAction's computation can be accessed through the RuntimeActionResult.getThrownException() method.

        Specified by:
        call in interface Callable<RuntimeActionResult>
        Overrides:
        call in class RuntimeAction<T extends RuntimePlatform>
        Returns:
        the RuntimeActionResult containing the raw result of the computation and monitoring information
        See Also:
        ExecutionService, RuntimeActionResult

      • getMessage

        protected String getMessage()
        Returns the processed message.
        Returns:
        the processed message

      • getClientSession

        protected abstract JarvisSession getClientSession()
        Returns the JarvisSession associated to the client of the message to send.

        This method is used by the RuntimeMessageAction constructor to pass client-independent context variables (e.g. from RuntimeEventProviders) to the client session.

        Returns:
        the JarvisSession associated to the client of the message to send
